abstract: Editorial asserts that the United States does not need to maintain as large a nuclear weapons arsenal as it has; argues that reducing the number of weapons, scaling back unnecessary modernization programs, and delaying or scrapping plans to replace some delivery systems will save billions of dollars for the country and help make the world safer.
snippet: The United States can save billions of dollars on its nuclear weapons program without compromising security.
